content.label: The game rocks
I love this game! It‚Äôs the best i‚Äôve ever played!  But one question. What was the reason behind the price dropping so low? I‚Äôm not bei  by mean to the best game, but why?

This is a unique experience, man.
I dig it.  Cool art.  Incredible music.  Spooky vibes and a dark, grim-style fairy tale of sorts.
I liked all of it, except the difficult navigation of the corridors.
Otherwise, YES.

It‚Äôs a good game. I like the vibe, the dark colors, the art style, and the creepy atmosphere a lot! The story is pretty heartbreaking, but it‚Äôs worth the play through. The upgrades are cool and puzzles aren‚Äôt as hard. It gets pretty addicting and hard to let go. Fight system is cool too; just parry all the monster attacks and go ham.

Genre is not what I usually go for in a game (I have poor reflexes and don‚Äôt find fighting as fun). However, totally loved this game. The story, atmosphere, backgrounds and more than anything the awesome monster designs were absorbing.

A beautifully designed game. I was captivated the entire time. A very interesting plot with some interesting developments.
I got stuck on the sun and moon thing and can‚Äôt move on
Absolutely love it!

title.label: Awesome game from creators of Guacamelee

content.label: Amazing combination of first person dungeon crawlers, Zelda, and fruit ninja.  The art and music is amazing, the story is unobtrusive and intriguing, and the gameplay is solid.  Wished it could have been slightly longer, though.  I beat it 100% in under 7 hours.

title.label: Not average, all highs and lows

content.label:
This is basically infinity blade gone Metroidvania. Which it does very well. Combat is tense and difficult without being frustrating, and had a good difficulty curve throughout. Leveling up and exploration are also done great. The story is sparse but powerfully told. I found the last hour to be a bit of a grind, but it held me easily for most of the game.

The bad? Blood. Chopping body parts. You collect heart pieces to increase your health, but then actually eat the heart. There is mutilation and giblets all over this game. I hate it. I hate it.

Game was good enough that I muscled through, but would never play again or recommend.

A deeply beautiful game with some genuinely challenging encounters that took me several tries. Though, as is often the nature of such things, the bosses themselves were often less difficult than some of the heavily buffed normal enemy clusters. Movement is a bit slow when you‚Äôre backtracking or exploring, but I adored this game and will happily replay it.

I love the art and story of the game and the only reason I gave it 3 stars..The game was easy to minimize while slashing on iPhone XR. I would be in mid counter attack and if I slashed a little too far I‚Äôd be on the home screen.

title.label: Doesn‚Äôt work for IPhone X or higher

content.label: The game is really good but on iPhone that doesn‚Äôt have a home button the game look horrible and the game play is really bad I have played this game on many devices like ps vita, 3ds and a ipad all of those devices played the game perfectly fine but on my iPhone 11 pro max the game doesn‚Äôt use doesn't center the picture in the middle of the screen it moves all the way to the right and sometimes the game starts glitching in a way that I can‚Äôt even leave any  menus like the map and the pause screen also on the start screen the start bottom is placed on the swipe up line to close/ leave apps so it was really hard to start the game hopefully we can get an update to fix this game because it is a really good game ‚Äî‚Äî I tried the game on 3 iPhone 11 pro max it had the same issues
I will keep it‚Äôs Simple. Not impressed.
I like this gameüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëç
Not formatted correctly for the 2019 iPhone 11 Pro Max. Can‚Äôt exit out of sub menus.

Well designed for mobile, engaging real-time combat and a killer aesthetic. A decent amount of content, too.
As far as improvements, I would recommend:
-An explicit save feature, so that players know where they‚Äôll return when they exit the game
-More assets. A lot of rooms begin to feel the same after just a short amount of play.
-Auto-walk through straight passages. It‚Äôs annoying to have to tap multiple times to navigate a single room when there‚Äôs nothing to stop for.

title.label: All I want to do is to feed my bird friend

content.label: I haven't finished the game yet so I don't know if there is an actual opportunity to do it, but I really only want to give the two-headed-bird-thing some giblets, he's helped me so much!! I The game has beautiful graphics, an easy to learn and easy to use battling style, an amazing story line, and original characters, but I'm only giving this four stars because I have yet to come across an option to feed some giblets to my bird friend.
I love this game because no in app purchases. Just one price and done.

First off, the art style of this game is beautiful. Second the way you control movement and the combat is perfect for a mobile game, simple but still requires a bit of skill. I would highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys tapping games, beautiful graphics, and an intriguing storyline.

The game's atmosphere and aesthetic as a whole really makes the game what it is, the story the art the buildings, it all comes together in great masterpiece of a game. For this being a noble game I‚Äôd argue that it is the best I‚Äôve ever had the pleasure of purchasing and playing to the fullest extent.
Story is interesting, gameplay is great and I love all the puzzles, highly recommended
One of the best games I ever played, money well spent.
The mechanics are natural and satisfying, the RPG leveling up is addicting, and it was hours of depth, probably will replay it again later to see if I missed anything.

Please play this game! It is so amazing! The story is interesting and in depth, the places and monsters are interesting, and even after you finish the game, you‚Äôll still have new things to discover. It can literally bring you to tears. I‚Äôve played through it like three times, it‚Äôs so wonderful

Please play this game! It is so amazing! The story is interesting and in depth, the places and monsters are interesting, and even after you finish the game, you‚Äôll still have new things to discover. It can literally bring you to tears. I‚Äôve played through it like three times, it‚Äôs so wonderful
It was a lot of fun
Great game with awesome mechanics. I couldnt put it down until I 100% it!

Normalmente no me gusta jugar en el tel√©fono pero este juego que compre al estar aburriendo en una sala de espera me engancho totalmente por sus gr√°ficos, su historia intrigante y mazmorras llenas de secretos y acertijos. Vale totalmente la pena. // Normally I don't like to play on the phone but this game that I bought while being bored in a waiting room totally hooked me by its graphics, its intriguing story and dungeons full of secrets and riddles.  Totally worth it.
Definitely a unique game. Ended up being really enjoyable with about 6 hours of play time.

It is really hard to find a true full fledge game on IOS. This game has a story, has a character silently evolving as you progress through the game, has interesting and well polished mechanics and it all fits within a few MGB. I wish there could be more games like this for IOS available. The game is well worth the price. I whole heartily recommend this game.

title.label: Most immersive mobile game I've ever played

content.label:
Excluding great games that are made into mobile ports, this is the most immersive game I've ever played on my iPad.  The gameplay mechanic, the story, the aesthetic, and the music/sound effects are perfect and very satisfying.   

Buy this game.  It's an experience that will stick with you.

I love this game to death! I have played through on both difficulties multiple times. I have 100% explored every area and found every secret multiple times. The combat is satisfying and fun and enough challenge and changes to keep if fresh throughout. The atmosphere is incredibly recognizable and adds to the story in a great way. The music is passionate and makes the experience all the better. I can‚Äôt believe it was made by such a small team. I can‚Äôt wait to play it again even if it‚Äôs just for the ending which brings me to tears every single time.

title.label: Fun but the sun and moon system is annoying

content.label: Everything is pretty easy to understand I completed the game 100% in a couple sittings without googling anything the gameplay is simply and not too challenging I‚Äôve never found myself stuck on a single encounter it‚Äôs very forgiving (on standard) I wish there was a harder difficulty it was pretty easy to just spam the blind on most enemies and kill them that way the only Other grievance I have with the game is the sun and moon system you find in the domain of the crows requires a lot of backtracking through a lot of the level multiple times to get all 18 secrets 10/10 would recommend

title.label: Fun at first but combat turns annoying

content.label: I love the story, art style, characters, and combat system of Severed. My only complaint whatsoever is that around midgame the combat takes a turn for the worse in that it expects you to rapidly take on new concepts and use them against many enemies before you‚Äôve gotten the hang of using it against even one. Perhaps this is different if you pick to play the casual difficulty instead of standard, but I‚Äôd think it speaks for itself when someone can play through the first third ~ half of the game relying on timing and strategy, but within a brief 30 minute window find they can no longer continue because they haven‚Äôt been given a chance to even attempt a certain type of parry before being thrown into a 3+ monster battle where they‚Äôre expected to use it flawlessly or die trying. It‚Äôs repetetive and annoying, and it just discourages the idea of opening the app back up. You get to this point and stop entirely because the thought of opening the app fills you with boredom and grief knowing what you‚Äôll be thrown back to. This absurd learning curve ruins the player‚Äôs ability to enjoy the game, and basically begs you to delete it.

Who need Xp when you have severed limbs? A twisting dark story sewn in with beautiful graphic and fun game play makes for one of greatest mobile games. I am enjoying it so thoroughly that I've put six hours in, and I only got it today. It's a fairly long game. I haven't completed it yet. It's dark and creepy and leaves you a bit traumatized but yearning for more it's.... Perfect.

Overall, great game. My complaint is the combat system. It‚Äôs super difficult to precisely swipe to block incoming attacks while turning to face a different enemy. When fighting 4 or more enemies, I just find it near impossible and almost always have to do several attempts.

title.label: Beautiful game, but heavily letterboxed on iPad

content.label:
I am LOVING Severed, but on my iPad Pro, there are enormous black bezels on the top, bottom, and sides of the game. The game could be so immersive, but instead it feels cramped.

Developers, please let this app fill the iPad display!
A great dungeon crawler I played all through, and I enjoyed the whole journey

This game keeps me hooked. The setting, story, and characters are mysterious and dreamlike. The art direction is spectacular! The game uses such incredibly bright colors, but has spooky and eerie set and monster design. I‚Äôm several hours in and I hope the adventure doesn‚Äôt end! I hope we get a sequel (if the story allows)!

This is a must get if you enjoy eerie worlds, strong female protagonists, and amazing monster design, get this game!

title.label: Legitimately One of My Favorite Games

content.label: It‚Äôs just fantastic. Gothic, horrific, grotesque, and weird.

The game is really pretty, and the idea of trying to save your family is unique, so I had a great time playing. Once you got near the middle of the story it loses momentum and things become tedious. 

*SPOILER ALERT*
I would have liked the game much better if at the end after defeating the dragon thing, you could find a way to save your family instead of just letting them all die. I didn‚Äôt like that the game just left me like that and I didn‚Äôt know what to do anymore so I gave up. Would earn more stars if there was more explanation or something to do after the ‚Äúend.‚Äù
Thanks!

Way better than Infinity Blade.  
It makes sense too seeing who made it - good ole Guacamelee devs!

Drinkbox Studios produced my all time favorite game Guacamelee, so I might be speaking from a place of bias, but this game was great. Stellar art direction using solid colors and beautiful palettes. An interesting gameplay mechanic that encourages skill and timing, then rewarding you with the in-game ‚Äúcurrency‚Äù used to upgrade yourself and your tools of combat. As well as an interesting story that was cryptic and alien at first, but I found myself thrust into this land as though it were my own by the end. All-in-all, not a complete waste if cash. Minor gripe is this game is a little harder to play on iPhone models without home buttons, I pulled up my home screen mid-battle so many times, but this game came out before those iPhones existed so you‚Äôre keeping the 5 stars Drinkbox. Please keep making great games ‚ù§Ô∏è
Bright colors and enjoying the environment.

title.label: One of the best games on hand held devices

content.label: A basic dungeon crawl game but with intuitive puzzles , story line and captivating gameplay.
Lacks bugs and is very engaging, I am not finished, but I am pretty hooked!
